block.p: Amy Elizabeth Bittle, the daughter of Rena Shapiro of Poughkeepsie, N.Y., and Peter Bittle of Ossining, N.Y., is to be married today to Dr. Andrew Jeffrey Zahalsky, a son of Linda and Elliot Zahalsky of Sarasota, Fla. Rabbi Harold Markman is to officiate at the Sheraton Civic Center Hotel in Poughkeepsie. The bride's mother, the cantor at Temple Beth-El in Poughkeepsie, will take part in the ceremony.

The bride, 25, is a special education teacher and social worker for the Child Development Center of the Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services in New York. She is a cum laude graduate of Tufts University and received master's degrees in social work from Columbia and in special education from Bank Street College of Education. Her father, a consultant on housing for the mentally ill, retired as a field office director in New York City for the State Office of Mental Health.

Amy Elizabeth Bittle, the daughter of Rena Shapiro of Poughkeepsie, N.Y., and Peter Bittle of Ossining, N.Y., is to be married today to Dr. Andrew Jeffrey Zahalsky, a son of Linda and Elliot Zahalsky of Sarasota, Fla. Rabbi Harold Markman is to officiate at the Sheraton Civic Center Hotel in Poughkeepsie. The bride's mother, the cantor at Temple Beth-El in Poughkeepsie, will take part in the ceremony.

The bride, 25, is a special education teacher and social worker for the Child Development Center of the Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services in New York. She is a cum laude graduate of Tufts University and received master's degrees in social work from Columbia and in special education from Bank Street College of Education. Her father, a consultant on housing for the mentally ill, retired as a field office director in New York City for the State Office of Mental Health.

The bridegroom, 29, is a fellow in oncology and hematology at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center in New York. He graduated magna cum laude from Brown, from which he also received an M.D. and a master's degree in molecular biology, cellular biology and biochemistry. His father has a law practice in Sarasota, for which his mother is the business director.
